data.event: The United States Census Bureau estimated its 2013 population at 20,370.
Marina was incorporated in 1975 and is the newest city on the Monterey Peninsula.
In 2012, Marina was named one of the 100 Best Community for Young People by America's Promise Alliance.[1].
The Fort Ord Station Veterinary Hospital, built in 1941 to provide healthcare for U.S. Army horses and mules, was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2014.

event.title: was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2014
